title: Behavior of derivative from graph of function

content.question: The graph of the function f is shown in the figure above. Which of the following could be the graph of f' , the derivative of f ?

choices.label: A curve begins above the x axis and to the left of the y axis. It moves down, crossing the x axis, and levels off at the y axis below the origin.  It continues up, crossing the x axis, and ends above the x axis and to the right of the y axis.

A curve begins below the x axis and to the left of the y axis.  It moves up, crossing the x axis, and levels off at the y axis above the origin.  It continues down, crossing the x axis, and ends below the x axis and to the right of the y axis.

A curve begins below the x axis and to the left of the y axis.  It moves up, then levels off at the origin. After intersecting the origin, it continues down and ends below the x axis and to the right of the y axis.

A curve begins below the x axis and to the left of the y axis. It moves steeply up, crossing the x axis, and then curves down and moves through the origin. It continues down to the right of the y axis and below the x axis, then curves steeply up, crossing the x axis, and ends above the x axis and to the right of the y axis.

A curve begins below the x axis and to the left of the y axis.  It moves steeply up, crossing the x axis, and then curves down. It levels off and moves through the origin.  It continues gradually up, and then curves steeply down, crossing the x axis, and ends below the x axis and to the right of the y axis.

content.answer: A curve begins below the x axis and to the left of the y axis.  It moves up, crossing the x axis, and levels off at the y axis above the origin.  It continues down, crossing the x axis, and ends below the x axis and to the right of the y axis.

topic.text: 5.8: Sketching Graphs of Functions and Their Derivatives

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
